trans-unit.target: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_SEQ_00<tab>Yabuqa watches the flames of the fire, a wistful expression upon his face.
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_000<tab>Say, friend, might you do me a favor?

TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_001<tab>Not too far to the southeast of here are the decimated ruins of Kahkol Iloh. I ask that you go there and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>pray<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for the souls of my deceased parents and sister.
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_002<tab><sigh> It is not a sentiment any of the other Buduga would understand, which is why I need for you to go in my stead.

TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_003<tab>Please, make your way to Kahkol Iloh and send your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>prayers<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to my parents and sister. Mayhap through you, they will receive mine, as well.
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_SYSTEM_000_005<tab><var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Pray<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for Yabuqa's dead family.

TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_010<tab>I appreciate you entertaining such an...odd request. Many of the other Budugan warriors will think me soft for it, but I always feel the need to send someone out to my old village at this time of year to pray for them.

TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_011<tab>Ah─it seems I neglected to tell you that I am originally from Kahkol Iloh. When I was a child, the Buduga came and pillaged our settlement. My family offered me up to them as tribute.

TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_012<tab>For the longest time I resented them. I eventually came to learn, however, that shortly after I left, a deadly epidemic swept through my old home and killed everyone who had been left behind.

TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_013<tab>I suspect my parents knew what was to come and sent me away to protect me. <sigh> I have years of making up to do for the hatred I harbored in my heart toward them.

TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_014<tab>As a member of the Buduga it is difficult for me to find opportunities to visit Kahkol Iloh and offer them my prayers. That is why I ask travelers passing through to lend me their assistance. You have my sincerest gratitude, friend.
